title: Tom Brady’s Chance to Work From Home—at the Super Bowl
sub_head: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers are one win away from becoming the first team to play the Super Bowl at its home stadium. The chances that it never happened before? Really low.
body:
Tom Brady has been to nine Super Bowls, won six and is one game from something that’s never been done in NFL history: playing a Super Bowl at home.
It’s already been a season of firsts for the 43-year-old. It’s his first season with a team other than the New England Patriots. It’s his first season playing with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Now, he can help the Bucs become the first team ever to play the season’s final game in their home stadium.
First, Brady has to take his team past Aaron Rodgers and the Green Bay Packers in Sunday’s NFC Championship, which is far from a guarantee. The Packers have been the NFC’s best team this year, while Rodgers has been the NFL’s best quarterback.
If the Buccaneers prevail, though, they’ll find themselves playing next in familiar confines: Raymond James Stadium, site of the Super Bowl on Feb. 7. Tampa Bay plays all of its home games there in front of a kitschy fake pirate ship armed with replica cannons.
